Description: Waters Technologies Corp. agreed to pay $6.5 million in settlement of alleged violations of state air and water pollution laws at its chromatography equipment manufacturing plant. It was found that because of numerous plant modifications and process changes the company had not reported accurate emission data for more than 20 years.

Agency: Massachusetts Executive Office of Energy and Environmental Affairs
Notes: Captured from records in EEA database with basic enforcement information; may not include full details of penalties.
